name: UpdateArchiveConfiguration
description:
Replace an existing archive configuration in Datadog.

Use this tool to update an archive configuration by replacing the current settings with new ones for a specified archive in your Datadog organization.

parameters.name: archive_identifier
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the archive you wish to update in Datadog.

parameters.name: new_archive_configuration
parameters.description: New definition of the archive including attributes like destination, tags, name, query, etc.

include_tags.description:
To store the tags in the archive, set the value "true".
If it is set to "false", the tags will be deleted when the logs are sent to the archive.

query.description: The archive query/filter. Logs matching this query are included in the archive.

rehydration_max_scan_size_in_gb.description: Maximum scan size for rehydration from this archive.

rehydration_tags.description: An array of tags to add to rehydrated logs from an archive.

attributes.description: The attributes associated with the archive.

type.description: The type of the resource. The value should always be archives.

metadata.description: Tools that enable LLMs to interact directly with the Datadog API.
